turns.speaker: SCHAEFFER
turns.text: He'll live.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You might have killed him!

turns.speaker: SCHAEFFER
turns.text: Find Fergie, check the barns. I'll watch these two.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFFER
turns.text: Get back in there.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: My son is out there!

turns.speaker: SCHAEFFER
turns.text: Nobody's going to hurt your son...

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Is this where we're going?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Of course not. We're going to Baltimore. It's much nicer in Baltimore.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Momma... are they angry with us.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: No... No. It is just the English way.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: I don't want to stay here.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: They are English. They don't understand.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: I wish dawdie was with us.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I know. Sleep now, Liebchen.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Aunt Em!

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Fifty-seven, fifty-eight --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Just listen to what Miss Gulch did to Toto! She --

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Dorothy, please!  We're trying to count! Fifty-eight--

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, but Aunt Em, she hit him over the --

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Seventy --  Dorothy, please!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, but he doesn't do it every day -- just once or twice a week.  And he can't catch her old cat, anyway. And now she says she's gonna get the sheriff, and --

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Dorothy!  Dorothy!  We're busy!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh -- all right.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Auntie Em, really -- you know what Miss Gulch said she was gonna do to Toto?  She said she was gonna --

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Now, Dorothy, dear, stop imagining things. You always get yourself into a fret over nothing.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No --

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Now, you just help us out today, and find yourself a place where you won't get into any trouble.

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Dorothy!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You wicked old witch!  Uncle Henry, Auntie Em, don't let 'em take Toto!  Don't let her take him -- please!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: -- no place like home -- there's no place like home -- no place --

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Dorothy.  Dorothy, dear. It's Aunt Em, darling.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, Auntie Em -- it's you!

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Yes, darling.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: But I did leave you, Uncle Henry -- that's just the trouble.  And I tried to get back for days and days.

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: There, there, lie quiet now.  You just had a bad dream.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No --

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Oh, we dream lots of silly things when we --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No, Aunt Em -- this was a real, truly live place.  And I remember that some of it wasn't very nice....

turns.speaker: UNCLE HENRY
turns.text: Poor little orphan, and her Miss Gulch troubles. Gosh all hemlock - you know, she ought to have somebody to play with.

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: I know, but we all got to work out our own problems, Henry.

turns.speaker: UNCLE HENRY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Oh, I hope we got them in time.

turns.speaker: UNCLE HENRY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: UNCLE HENRY
turns.text: Uhh -- yeah --

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Now, we can't go against the law, Dorothy. I'm afraid poor Toto will have to go.

turns.speaker: HICKORY
turns.text: Look at you, Zeke -- you're just as white --

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Here, here, what's all this jabber-wapping when there's work to be done?  I know three shiftless farm hands that'll be out of a job before they know it!

turns.speaker: HICKORY
turns.text: Well, Dorothy was walking along the --

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: I saw you tinkering with that contraption, Hickory. Now, you and Hunk get back to that wagon!

turns.speaker: HICKORY
turns.text: All right, Mrs. Gale.  But some day they're going to erect a statue to me in this town, and --

turns.speaker: AUNT EM
turns.text: Well, don't start posing for it now.  Here, here -- can't work on an empty stomach. Have some crullers.

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: As Mayor of the Munchkin City In the County of the Land of Oz I welcome you most regally

turns.speaker: BARRISTER
turns.text: But we've got to verify it legally To see...

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: To see?

turns.speaker: BARRISTER
turns.text: If she...

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: If she?

turns.speaker: BARRISTER
turns.text: Is morally, ethic'ly

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: Then this is a day of Independence For all the Munchkins and their descendants!

turns.speaker: BARRISTER
turns.text: If any!

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: Yes, let the joyous news be spread.

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: From now on you'll be history

turns.speaker: BARRISTER
turns.text: You'll be hist...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Our echo.

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: Tap - tap - tap - tap - What was that - that - that? Our echo - echo - echo.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, come on - come on! We'll soon find the Wizard!

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: The Wizard - The Wizard - The Great and Powerful Wizard of Oz - Oz - Oz-Oz - Oz - Oz - Oz - Oz!

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: ...have you come back?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Please, sir.  We've done what you told us. We've brought you the broomstick of the Wicked Witch of the West.  We melted her.

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: ...resourceful!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes, sir.  So we'd like you to keep your promise to us, if you please, sir.

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: Not so fast!  Not....

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: If you were really great and powerful, you'd keep your promises!

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: Do you presume to criticize the....

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: ... -- Oz -- has spoken!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: Well, I -- I -- I am the Great and Powerful -- Wizard of Oz.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You are?

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Uhhhh -- yes...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I don't believe you!

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: No, I'm afraid it's true. There's no other Wizard except me.

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Yes-s-s -- that...that's exactly so.  I'm a humbug!

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Frightened?  You are talking to a man who has laughed in the face of death -- sneered at doom and chuckled at catastrophe.  I was petrified.  Then suddenly the wind changed, and the balloon floated down into the heart of this noble city, where I was instantly acclaimed Oz, the First Wizard de Luxe!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Ohhh!

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Times being what they were, I accepted the job, -- retaining my balloon against the advent of a quick get-away.  And in that balloon, my dear Dorothy, you and I will return to the land of E Pluribus Unum!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh!  Come back!  Don't go without me! Please come back!

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: I can't come back!  I don't know how it works!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Goodbye, folks!

turns.speaker: HICKORY
turns.text: Oh! Oh, it feels like my joints are rusted. Listen, Dorothy, don't let Hunk kid you about Miss Gulch. She's just a poor sour-faced old maid that -- she ain't got no heart left. You know, you should have a little more heart yourself, and have pity on her.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Well, gee, I try and have a heart.

turns.speaker: HICKORY
turns.text: Now look, here's something that really has a heart. This is the best invention I ever invented.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: This?

turns.speaker: HICKORY
turns.text: Sure. It's to break up winds, so we don't have no more dust storms. Can you imagine what it'll mean to this section of the country? I'll show you. It works perfectly now. Here's the principle. You see that fan -- that sends up air currents into the sky. These air currents -- Oh, stop it!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: HICKORY
turns.text: Who did it? Now wait a minute.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Hickory!

turns.speaker: HICKORY
turns.text: Now what happened? I'll bet Hunk did that.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh!  Oh, Zeke!  Help!  Help me, Zeke!  Get me out of here!  Help!

turns.speaker: HICKORY
turns.text: Are you all right, Dorothy?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes, I'm all right.  Oh -- I fell in and -- and Zeke --

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: ...didn't you?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No -- No!  It was an accident! I didn't mean to kill anybody!....

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: What are you going to do with my dog?  Give him back to me!

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: All in good time, my little pretty -- all in good time.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, please give me back my dog!

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: Certainly -- certainly -- when you give me those slippers.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: But the Good Witch of the North told me not to.

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: Very well! Throw that basket in the river and drown him!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No!  No -- no!  Here -- you can have your old slippers -- but give me back Toto.

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: That's a good little girl.  I knew you'd see reason.

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: Ahh!  Ah!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I didn't do it!  Can I still have my dog?

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: No!  Fool, that I am!  I should have remembered -- those slippers will never come off, as long as...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Run, Toto, run!

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: Catch him, you fool!

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Are you a good witch, or a bad witch?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Who, me?  Why, I'm not a witch at all.  I'm Dorothy Gale from Kansas.

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Oh!  Well....

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Toto's my dog.

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Well, I'm a little muddled.  The Munchkins called me because a new witch has just dropped a house on the Wicked Witch of the East.  And there's the house, and here you are, and that's all...

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: The Munchkins are happy because you have freed them from the Wicked Witch of the East.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh.  But, if you please -- what are Munchkins?

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: The little people who live in this land -- it's Munchkinland, and you are their national heroine, my dear.  It's all right -- you may all come out and thank her. It's all right now - you may all come out.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I thought you said she was dead.

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: That was her sister -- the Wicked Witch of the East. This is the Wicked Witch of the West.  And she's worse than the other one was.

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Pooh -- what a smell of sulphur!  I'm afraid you've made rather a bad enemy of the Wicked Witch of the West.  The sooner you get out of Oz altogether, the safer you'll sleep, my dear.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, I'd give anything to get out of Oz altogether -- but which is the way back to Kansas?  I can't go the way I came.

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: No -- that's true. The only person who might know would be the great and wonderful Wizard of Oz himself!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: The Wizard of Oz?  Is he good or is he wicked?

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Oh, very good, but very mysterious.  He lives in the Emerald City, and that's a long journey from here. Did you bring your broomstick with you?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No, I'm afraid I didn't.

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Well, then, you'll have to walk.  The Munchkins will see you safely to the border of Munchkinland.  And remember, never let those ruby slippers off your feet for a moment, or you will be at the mercy of the Wicked Witch of the West.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: But, how do I start for Emerald City?

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: It's always best to start at the beginning -- and all you do is follow the Yellow Brick Road.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, will you help me?  Can you help me?

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: You don't need to be helped any longer. You've always had the power to go back to Kansas.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I have?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: ...Toto, too?

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Toto, too.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, now?

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Whenever you wish.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, dear -- that's too wonderful to be true! Oh, it's -- it's going to be so hard to say goodbye.  I love you all, too.  Goodbye, Tin Man.  Oh, don't cry.  You'll rust so dreadfully.  Here -- here's your oil-can. Goodbye.

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Are you ready now?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes.  Say goodbye, Toto.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes, I'm ready now.

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Then close your eyes, and tap your heels together three times.

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: And think to yourself -- "There's no place like home; there's no place like home; there's no place like home."

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: There's no place like home.  There's no place like home.  There's no place like home.  There's no place like home.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Let's see -- you're -- you're travelling in disguise. No, that's not right.  I -- you're -- you're going on a visit.  No, I'm wrong. That's...You're -- running away.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: How did you guess?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Professor Marvel never guesses -- he knows! Now, why are you running away?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Why --

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: No, no --  now don't tell me.  They -- they don't understand you at home.  They don't appreciate you. You want to see other lands -- big cities -- big mountains -- big oceans --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Why, it's just like you could read what was inside of me.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Yes --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Please, Professor, why can't we go along with you?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Oh, yes - you - you wanted to go home, huh?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, no, I wanted to go along with you.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Nobody cares about me at home. They wouldn't even miss me.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Aw, come, come, come --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No, they won't - honestly.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Auntie Em was even going to let them kill Toto yesterday for biting Miss Gulch. Oh, please, Professor, why can't we go with you and see all the Crowned Heads of Europe?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Do you know any?  Oh, you mean the thing -- Yes, well, I -- I never do anything without consulting my crystal first. Let's....

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: That's our farm!

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Oh -- yes.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: ...her face is careworn.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes...That's Aunt Em.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Her -- her name is Emily.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: That's right.  What's she doing?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Well, I -- I can't quite see.  Why, she's crying.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Someone has hurt her -- someone has just about broken her heart.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I had the measles once -- and she stayed right by me every minute.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: What's she doing now?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: ...room --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Has it poppies on the wall....

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: ...paper?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: I said it had poppies on the wall paper! Eh -- she's -- What's this?  Why, she's -- she's putting her hand on her heart -- she's -- she's dropping down on the....

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: ...bed.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, no -- no!

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: That's all -- the Crystal's gone dark.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, you....

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: ...you don't suppose she could really be sick, do you? Oh -- Oh, I've got to go home right away!

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: But -- what's this?  I thought you were going along with me.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, no, no, I have to get to her right....

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: But you couldn't have been, could you?

turns.speaker: MISS GULCH
turns.text: That dog's a menace to the community.  I'm taking him to the sheriff and make sure he's destroyed.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Destroyed?  Toto?  Oh, you can't!  You mustn't! Auntie Em!  Uncle Henry!  You won't let her, will you?

turns.speaker: MISS GULCH
turns.text: Now you're seeing reason.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No --

turns.speaker: MISS GULCH
turns.text: Here's what I'm taking him in -- so he can't attack me again.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, no, no!  I won't let you take him!  You go away, you....!  Oooh, I'll bite you myself!

turns.speaker: MISS GULCH
turns.text: Here!  I've got an order!  Let me have...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Stop her!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oil can.....Oil can....

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Did you say something?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oil can....

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Where do you want to be oiled first?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: My mouth -- my mouth!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: ...m...m...my, my, my, my goodness -- I can talk again! Oh -- oil my arms, please -- oil my elbows.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: ...Oh, did that hurt?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: No -- it feels wonderful.  I've held that axe up for ages.  Oh ---

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, goodness!  How did you ever get like this?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh -- well, about a year ago -- I was chopping that tree -- minding my own business -- when suddenly it started to rain....

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: ...and right in the middle of a chop, I...I rusted solid.  And I've been that way ever since.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Well, you're perfect now.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: My...my neck.  My...my neck.  Perfect?  Oh -- bang on my chest if you think I'm perfect.  Go ahead -- bang on it!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: All hollow.  Oh --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, are you all right?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: I'm afraid I'm a little rusty yet.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, dear -- That was wonderful!  You know -- we were just wondering why you couldn't come to Emerald City with us to ask the Wizard of Oz for a heart.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Emerald City? Why, that's a long and dangerous journey. And it might rain on the way.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Well, suppose the Wizard wouldn't get me one when we got there?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, but he will!  He must!  We've come such a long way already.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Ohh -- what's that? Oh --

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh! They're - they're gone now.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, goodness! Did any of them sting you?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: I - I guess they tried to, but they bent their stingers.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, dear. I don't know what I'd do if a whole swarm kept -- Oh! Oh! Oh, there's one on me!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh - I'll get it!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh! Oh!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh, see - I killed it. Oh, I killed that poor little honey bee!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh-oh-

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: And I was standing over there rusting for the longest time.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Still, I wish I could remember.   But, I guess it doesn't matter anyway.  We know each other now, don't we?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: We might.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: And bears!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: What sort of an animal is that?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: It-it-it-it - it's a huge one!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: And him a brain.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I'm sure he could give you some courage.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Can't that female take no for an answer?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh, he's just ascared again.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Don't you know the Wizard's going to give you some courage?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: No.  Why only --  Oh --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh!  Oh, Tin Man!   Oh!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh! Something bit me, too!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Now come on - you're acting silly --

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Dorothy!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I knew you would!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Tomorrow?  Oh, but I want to go home now.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: You've had plenty of time already!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Ahh --- Oh, it ticks!  Listen!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes...!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: ...yes.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Look -- it ticks!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Now I know I've got a heart -- 'cause it's breaking.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --  Goodbye, Lion.  You know, I know it isn't right, but I'm going to miss the way you used to holler for help before you found your courage.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, my!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN -- SCARECROW AND DOROTHY
turns.text: Lions and tigers and bears!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, my!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN -- SCARECROW AND DOROTHY
turns.text: Lions and tigers and bears!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, my!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN -- SCARECROW AND DOROTHY
turns.text: Lions and tigers and bears!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, my!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN -- SCARECROW AND DOROTHY
turns.text: Lions and tigers and bears!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, my!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: What -- what did you do that for?  I didn't bite him.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No, but you tried to.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: It's bad enough picking on a straw man, but when you go around picking on poor little dogs --

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Well, you didn't have to go and hit me, did you?  Is my nose bleeding?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Well, of course not.  My goodness, what a fuss you're making.  Well, naturally, when you go around picking on things weaker than you are -- Why, you're nothing but a great big coward!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: You're right -- I am a coward.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: ...has been simply unbearable.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Yeh, it's sad, believe me, Missy When you're born to be a sissy, Without the vim and verve. But I could show my prowess -- Be a lion not a mou-ess -- If I only had the nerve I'm afraid there's no denyin' I'm just a dande-lion -- A fate I don't deserve. I'd be brave as a blizzard --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: A home --

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: The nerve.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: It's beautiful, isn't it?  Just like I knew it would be.  He really must be a wonderful Wizard to live in a City like that!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Well, come on, then.  What are we waiting for?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes -- let's run!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Oh -- unusual weather we're having, ain't it?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Look!  He's rusted again.  Oh, give me the oil can -- quick!  Oh-oh, quick!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Ho -- ho --ho -- ho

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Hah!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Who's her?  Who's her?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: It's the Witch!  She's followed us here!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, but -- but please. It's very important.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: And -- and I got a permanent just for the occasion.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I'll be home in time for supper!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: In another hour, I'll be King of the Forest. Long Live the King!  If....

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Your Majesty, if you were king You wouldn't be afraid of anything?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Not nobody, not nohow!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: How about a hippopotamus?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Why, I'd thrash him from top to bottomamus!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Supposin' you met an elephant?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: I'd wrap him up in cellophant!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: I'd be too scared to ask him for it.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, well, then -- we'll ask him for you.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: I'd sooner wait outside.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: But why?  Why?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Because I'm still scared!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, come on.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Ohh!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh -- Oh, come on.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Huh?  What'd he say?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Does it work?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: No, but it's wonderful for threatening with.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --
